abstracts.cdata!:
This Implementation Completion Report
            (ICR) covers both the Fourth Power Project and the Kureimat
            Power Project in Egypt. The principal objectives of the
            Fourth Power Project were to: (a) assist the Egyptian
            Electricity Authority (EEA) in alleviating power shortages;
            (b) meet growing demand for electricity; (c) improve the
            efficiency of the existing power plants; (d) transfer
            technology related to installation and operation of
            high-efficiency combined-cycle power plants; (e) help
            strengthen EEA by improving accounting, management
            information systems (MIS). The principal objectives of the
            Kureimat Power Project were similar to those for the Fourth
            Power Project. Overall, Bank performance is rated
            satisfactory. The overall performance of EEA was
            satisfactory, particularly with regard to the physical
            implementation of the projects. The economic goals of the
            projects have not been achieved, but the physical objectives
            have for the most part been achieved. Key Lessons Learned:
            First, facilitating financial reforms in public utilities
            through sector reforms would be more effective than the
            standard financial covenants adopted by the Bank; Second,
            improving project risk analysis and management during
            project appraisal and adapting covenants to evolving
            conditions would minimize the risk of, if not completely
            avoid, project suspension/cancellation; Third, clearly
            ranking and prioritizing project objectives and identifying
            development impact indicators and project performance
            monitoring indicators would improve the management and
            implementation of projects; Fourth, for large-scale projects
            with significant co-financier/donor involvement, the Bank
            should have a common policy agreement with the financing
            partners and with the client.
